skill.name: ship-learn-next
skill.description: Transform learning content (like YouTube transcripts, articles, tutorials) into actionable implementation plans using the Ship-Learn-Next framework. Use when user wants to turn advice, lessons, or educational content into concrete action steps, reps, or a learning quest.
skill.summary: Convert educational content into actionable Ship-Learn-Next cycles with concrete, shippable learning iterations.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified documentation patterns as security issues. The skill contains only markdown documentation with example templates and conversation guides - no executable code, no cryptographic operations, and no system access patterns. This is a pure prompting skill with zero runtime risk.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to apply educational content because they consume without doing. This skill transforms passive learning (videos, articles, tutorials) into active practice through structured Ship-Learn-Next cycles that build real skills through repetition.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes transcripts, articles, tutorials to extract actionable lessons
Creates structured Ship-Learn-Next cycles with SHIP-LEARN-NEXT phases
Designs progressive reps that build skills through repetition
Frames specific, measurable learning goals with clear success criteria
Generates complete quest plans with reflection questions
Saves plans as Markdown files with consistent naming conventions
limitations: Does not provide content - users must supply learning material
Does not execute or verify user actions
Does not track progress across sessions
Focuses on individual skill building, not team workflows

use_cases.title: Video Tutorial to Practice Plan
use_cases.description: User watched a YouTube tutorial and wants to actually implement the techniques taught. The skill extracts key lessons and creates a practice plan with concrete reps.
use_cases.target_user: Self-directed learners who consume content but struggle to apply it

use_cases.title: Course Notes to Action Steps
use_cases.description: User has course notes or documentation and wants to practice immediately. The skill identifies the minimal starting point and creates a progressive skill-building path.
use_cases.target_user: Online course students who want to move beyond passive watching

use_cases.title: Article to Implementation Guide
use_cases.description: User read an article with advice and wants to take action. The skill converts theoretical advice into specific, shippable tasks with measurable outcomes.
use_cases.target_user: Professionals seeking to apply business or technical advice

prompt_templates.title: Basic Request
prompt_templates.prompt: I watched this video about [topic]. Here's the transcript: [attach file]. Help me create an actionable plan to actually practice these techniques.
prompt_templates.scenario: User has learning content and wants immediate guidance

prompt_templates.title: Defined Goal
prompt_templates.prompt: I have this [article/tutorial/course notes] about [subject]. I want to achieve [specific goal] in [timeframe]. Create a Ship-Learn-Next plan with concrete reps.
prompt_templates.scenario: User has a clear goal and wants structured learning iterations

prompt_templates.title: Minimal Starting Point
prompt_templates.prompt: I have too much content to process. Help me identify the minimum I need to learn to [complete specific task] this week. Create a small, shippable first rep.
prompt_templates.scenario: User feels overwhelmed and needs a small starting point

prompt_templates.title: Reflection and Iteration
prompt_templates.prompt: I just completed Rep 1 of my learning quest: [describe what happened]. Based on what I learned, create a plan for Rep 2 that adds one new element.
prompt_templates.scenario: User completed an iteration and wants to plan the next step

output_examples.input: I watched a cold email outreach video. Here's the transcript. Help me implement this.
output_examples.output: Created Ship-Learn-Next Plan - Cold Email Outreach.md with Rep 1: Send 10 cold emails this week. Includes success criteria, action steps, and reflection questions for after shipping.

output_examples.input: I have React course notes. I want to build a portfolio site in 6 weeks.
output_examples.output: Created Ship-Learn-Next Plan - Build React Portfolio.md with Rep 1: Build and deploy single-page portfolio with name and one project by Friday. Progressive reps outlined through Rep 5.

output_examples.input: I read this article about product development. How do I apply these principles?
output_examples.output: Created Ship-Learn-Next Plan - Proven Markets Product.md extracting 4 core principles. Rep 1: Validate market interest with 5 potential customers this week.

best_practices: Push for specific, measurable goals rather than vague intentions like 'learn X'
Start with embarrassingly small reps that can be completed in 1-7 days
Always include reflection questions after each shipped rep to capture learning
anti_patterns: Creating study plans instead of ship plans with actual deliverables
Listing all resources to read instead of identifying minimal resources for current rep
Letting users plan forever without committing to a first ship date

faq.question: What is the Ship-Learn-Next framework?
faq.answer: A three-phase learning cycle: SHIP (create something real), LEARN (reflect honestly on results), NEXT (plan the next iteration based on learnings). It prioritizes doing over studying.

faq.question: What content types work best with this skill?
faq.answer: YouTube transcripts, blog articles, course notes, tutorials, and any educational material with actionable advice. The skill extracts principles and converts them to practice tasks.

faq.question: How long should each rep take?
faq.answer: Each rep should be completable in 1-7 days. Rep 1 should be the smallest possible version - embarrassingly small is better than too ambitious.

faq.question: Does this skill track my progress between sessions?
faq.answer: No. This skill creates plans and helps plan iterations, but does not store or track progress. Users return after completing reps to plan the next step.

faq.question: How many reps should I plan?
faq.answer: The skill typically creates 5 reps with increasing challenge. Each rep adds ONE new element. Details beyond Rep 2-3 will evolve based on actual learning.

faq.question: What makes a good Ship-Learn-Next goal?
faq.answer: Good goals are specific and measurable: 'Get 2 responses from 10 cold emails' not 'Learn sales'. They produce real artifacts and have clear completion criteria.
